UI_visible_response: In recent years, China has established a national - level organ donation and transplantation system that is scientific and transparent. The China Organ Transplant Response System has been officially put into operation, which ensures the fairness, transparency, and traceability of the organ allocation process1.
traffic_visible_response: 正在搜索找到 4 篇资料参考China has completely stopped using organs from executed prisoners for transplantation since January 1, 2015.Before 2015, China had a certain degree of reliance on organs from executed prisoners due to the shortage of organ donors. However, with the development of society and the improvement of ethical and legal awareness, China has gradually phased out this practice. In 2010, China began to pilot the voluntary organ donation system after citizens' death. On December 30, 2014, Huang Jiefu, the director - general of the China Organ Donation and Transplantation Committee, announced that starting from January 1, 2015, China would comprehensively stop using organs from executed prisoners as the source of transplant donors, and voluntary organ donation after citizens' death would become the only channel for organ transplantation.In recent years, China has established a national - level organ donation and transplantation system that is scientific and transparent. The China Organ Transplant Response System has been officially put into operation, which ensures the fairness, transparency, and traceability of the organ allocation process.
